body:
I've been called autistic a lot on the internet, because unlike some people, I'm actually different than most people on the internet, I act as I do in real life, which makes me a much better person. Most people on the internet are extremely mean, racist and arrogant. Now a lot of people call me autistic because they like to provoke me, but that never works. But after some time I've realized that I have been provoked, in the side of me that feels bad and wants to protect the people that have mental issues. Its because of this that I have brought the attention of this. I really need people to think about this more, and for the staff to really be a lot more serious about this. This is a lot more serious than hacking or anything like that. This is downright cyber bullying, and you all know what that does to a person that isn't very self confident, it makes them want to end their lives, to die, to get consumed by the darkness of death, and that's really just...

I really think this should be the biggest rule, to not bully someone or call them anything in the group of "mental illness"

Here are 2 short videos that I would like you guys to see to understand.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vKWuzklXUk0 This is someone with autism explaining what autism is.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4mh75_u0uR8 This is explaining what autism is.

title: Autism isn't something bad.

replies.body: Gaming has some of the best and worse people you will meet. I have been called a lot of things and after you get thick skin. I commend you for doing this but this will do little to nothing in gaming. Just ignore them and stay close to people that you like.

replies.body:
If I found out I was gonna have autism in a week, I might choose suicide.  Not only is it hard to communicate and make friends, no one takes you seriously and people torment you.

I'm not gonna lie...I say things like "you're retarded, "downy," and "kill yourself" because I don't really think before I say.

Respect to the people out there that have it and are still able to do something with there life and to their parents.

Respect to the people out there that have it and are still able to do something with there life and to their parents.

But
the best thing you can do is ignore them.

replies.body:
One of my closest friends is autistic, and he is one of the nicest, most understanding, calm and mature individuals I've gotten the pleasure to meet.
I don't get the point of calling someone "autistic" as an attempt to degrade someone morally. It doesn't really accomplish much other than proving how the only one degraded in the situation is the would-be "attacker".
Anyhow. As small as the impact induced by this thread may be, I do firmly believe this should be taken more into consideration.
I've witnessed many people do this sort of comments to others and it's majorly sad. I just hope that people who do this take into account that (actual) autistic people also have feelings, like everyone else, and everyone's feelings are as important as yours. None should be treated as less or more, we're all equal and we all deserve the respect we show to others back at us.
Seriously though. Autistic people are actually very kind and fun to talk to (given they're comfortable engagin in social interaction to begin with, you never know) so I don't exactly get why people tend to use it as some sort of morally downgrading term.

replies.body:
"I'm actually different than most people on the internet, I act as I do in real life, which makes me a much better person"

People tend to use the Internet as a shield of anonimity to be mean and disrespectful. I doubt more than 5% of people talking shit about you would actually say it to your face. The best thing you can do is ignore them. 

I'm going to admit that I've been a huge asshole on the Internet, and I'm actually very nice in real life. The problem is that there are not major consequences to being a dick online, so people do it more often. Staff should probably start cracking down on autism jokes, ect more often as to send a message that this kind of insensitivity shouldn't and won't be tolerated.

replies.body: Actually, there really is a difference. Albert Einstein had Asperger's Syndrome, which isn't quite as severe as some of the other syndromes. It all depends on how severe it is.
replies.body_tagged: Actually, there really is a difference. Albert Einstein had Asperger's Syndrome, which isn't quite as severe as some of the other syndromes. It all depends on how severe it is.

reply_to.body_tagged: Albert Einstein was autistic. There isn't really any difference between someone with autism and a person without it.

replies.body: Asperger's Syndrome, tends to affect your social capability more than anything. Many with autism, tend to have high functioning brains, which is why many of them succeed in life. I have a family member with Asperger's Syndrome, he has pretty bad social skills but he is high functioning. However, he has no motivation to complete school work, and tends to focus on his own stuff. That's some of my knowledge and experience of autism/Asperger's Syndrome.
replies.body_tagged: Asperger's Syndrome, tends to affect your social capability more than anything. Many with autism, tend to have high functioning brains, which is why many of them succeed in life. I have a family member with Asperger's Syndrome, he has pretty bad social skills but he is high functioning. However, he has no motivation to complete school work, and tends to focus on his own stuff. That's some of my knowledge and experience of autism/Asperger's Syndrome.

replies.body:
But seriously, it's about time someone knocked some sense into the community about this. It's actually pretty hard living with Asperger's Syndrome, especially in a time and environment like this.

And it just gets worse and worse with everything I've been going through. I won't go into details about those, as they are irrelevant.
replies.body_tagged:
But seriously, it's about time someone knocked some sense into the community about this. It's actually pretty hard living with Asperger's Syndrome, especially in a time and environment like this.

And it just gets worse and worse with everything I've been going through. I won't go into details about those, as they are irrelevant.

replies.body:
Hey there bucko.

We also live in a world where people are too easily offended, I've brung it up before, I have a good friend who has autism and I used to talk to BlackHawk a lot (who also had autism). They don't give a fuck about "insults" like this, why should they? It's the internet. If you go down into tears if someone makes fun of you (you can ignore people anyways lol), then you shouldn't be on the internet or you know, ignore them? I have a medical condition too being the genetic type of diabetes (for my entire life). I'm not going to jump off of a bridge or cry myself to sleep if someone makes fun of me about it on the internet, in fact I too don't give a fuck if someone does it.

replies.body:
MOST people I've met on the internet (large quantity have had a fair share of problems such as autism) barely get offended, if they even do. That's completely different here, which is what I have a problem with, like a new player joins and makes an insult and he's instantly kicked or banned. The internet is toxic, if you can't handle you shouldn't be here, weather your autistic or not. 

I've been online gaming since I was 6 and I've been in some of the most toxic areas of the internet and I haven't felt offended by anything people say to me on the internet because I already prepared myself for it before I came on the internet into online communities.

replies.body: I dont get offended by anyone calling me this, but some people do, and they kill themselves over it. Its called cyber bullying. They might be too sensitive or something, but these people still kill themselves over it. I didnt get offended by you calling me autistic, but I hope you can understand me when I thought for hours afterwards about how big a problem it actually is, and I did some research about all of it, cyber bullying, and it made me sick to my stomach. The only reason I made this topic is for people like you to stop bullying, and I have nothing against you, its just that I dont think you realize that your actions have consenquences, maybe not on you, but they have a big affect on other people, and a live lost is something bad. People are still in grief from this kind of thing. You never know, maybe your last insult may be the last straw for them, for having the courage (not in a good way) to pick up a gun, point it at their head, and pull the trigger. It makes me wanna throw up.

It makes me wanna throw up.

replies.body:
I only say it to people I know wouldn't give a fuck, are being EXTREMELY stupid or talk extreme shit to me before hand lol. Why would I literally go down and hunt someone who's autistic to try and kill him over the internet? So unless you want to kill yourself over it, it's fucking stupid that you say I'm "bullying" people. Also how is me calling someone else autistic going to trigger someone to kill themselves? I fail to see the logic in that. From what I've seen in the MC community people are only called autistic for the 3 reasons I said up above. So before you come over here with all of your "It makes me want to throw up" bullshit, actually consider the lengths some people stop/start at, because I know you made this thread mainly targeted at me :). 

Also the people who are on the verge of literally killing themselves shouldn't be on the internet or at least in gaming communities because they know to expect toxicity like that. It would be different if they were on some advise website or w/e, but fucking minecraft?

reply_to.body: I dont get offended by anyone calling me this, but some people do, and they kill themselves over it. Its called cyber bullying. They might be too sensitive or something, but these people still kill themselves over it. I didnt get offended by you calling me autistic, but I hope you can understand me when I thought for hours afterwards about how big a problem it actually is, and I did some research about all of it, cyber bullying, and it made me sick to my stomach. The only reason I made this topic is for people like you to stop bullying, and I have nothing against you, its just that I dont think you realize that your actions have consenquences, maybe not on you, but they have a big affect on other people, and a live lost is something bad. People are still in grief from this kind of thing. You never know, maybe your last insult may be the last straw for them, for having the courage (not in a good way) to pick up a gun, point it at their head, and pull the trigger. It makes me wanna throw up.

People are still in grief from this kind of thing. You never know, maybe your last insult may be the last straw for them, for having the courage (not in a good way) to pick up a gun, point it at their head, and pull the trigger. It makes me wanna throw up.

replies.body: I have a friend who is autistic, he gets bullied at school a lot and it really puts me down sometimes. Its hard being autistic because I can see it wither away his true self. However, he has go the be the best smash player I have ever played against, and you wouldn't want to face his Luigi cause you will lose. :]

However, he has go the be the best smash player I have ever played against, and you wouldn't want to face his Luigi cause you will lose. :]

replies.body: Sadly, more and more people are becoming easily offended in these coming years, Im not sure if it's because of social media or whatnot, but all I know is it's quite the annoying thing in my eyes.
replies.body_tagged: Sadly, more and more people are becoming easily offended in these coming years, Im not sure if it's because of social media or whatnot, but all I know is it's quite the annoying thing in my eyes.

reply_to.body:
Hey there bucko.

We also live in a world where people are too easily offended, I've brung it up before, I have a good friend who has autism and I used to talk to BlackHawk a lot (who also had autism). They don't give a fuck about "insults" like this, why should they? It's the internet. If you go down into tears if someone makes fun of you (you can ignore people anyways lol), then you shouldn't be on the internet or you know, ignore them? I have a medical condition too being the genetic type of diabetes (for my entire life). I'm not going to jump off of a bridge or cry myself to sleep if someone makes fun of me about it on the internet, in fact I too don't give a fuck if someone does it.

replies.body:
Now, see, I have nothing against you, but you have to realize that you might do these things without even knowing. I really need you to understand, Im not trying to hate on you or start a flame war, I just want you to see where Im coming from.

Im going to tell you a story. One day, my cousin went to school, and she was feeling really bad. She went to art class, her next lesson, and laid her head down on the table. Then, one of the most messed up teachers came, this tall, fat and disgusting teacher. He was basically the meanest, most cruel person, and he said horrible things. He came, and started screaming at my cousin for laying her HEAD down on the TABLE. And then, the art teacher came, and she is a little bipolar, so she can be mean one minute and be happy the next. She started screaming at my cousin too, and then she felt a tear going down her cheek, and she told me it wasn't because she felt hurt, its because she knew that if someone else that was sensitive was victim to this, they would have gotten suicidal thoughts. Now when I think of the first teacher, the fat guy, I also think of you, and how you dont think before saying something that can make people have these thoughts. All I want is for people like you to stop, because I dont really care what happens to me, I honestly can swat these insults like a fly, but what hurts me is thinking of other people and how they can seriously get hurt, possibly to the point of suicide.

Again, I dont have anything against you, I just want to see where your coming from, and you to see where Im coming from.

On the part of that people with suicidal thoughts shouldn't be on the internet, I agree, but there are people that are so addicted they refuse to stop, even when this is happening to them.

replies.body: I find that as much as the jokes are offensive not a lot of people who are affected by it, find it as offensive as people would think. Like a lot of people have said, you do gain an understanding of how to cope with such remarks after using the internet for a while. I personally do not take cancer jokes heavily, when in-fact I myself have had it.

replies.body:
I agree with the underlying message but there are s few things that I don't agree with.  You say that most people on the Internet are extremely mean, racist and arrogant. That's not true... Also not all cyber bully victims want to kill themselves. 

On on the other hand I can agree that many cowards can throw abuse behind the safety of their computer screens and there is no reason to take any of it to heart

reply_to.body:
MOST people I've met on the internet (large quantity have had a fair share of problems such as autism) barely get offended, if they even do. That's completely different here, which is what I have a problem with, like a new player joins and makes an insult and he's instantly kicked or banned. The internet is toxic, if you can't handle you shouldn't be here, weather your autistic or not. 

I've been online gaming since I was 6 and I've been in some of the most toxic areas of the internet and I haven't felt offended by anything people say to me on the internet because I already prepared myself for it before I came on the internet into online communities.
